item.name: Job state
item.params: select isnull(convert(varchar(4000), (select j.[name] + N' - ' + convert(varchar(19), msdb.dbo.agent_datetime(h.run_date, h.run_time), 120) + '; ' from msdb.dbo.sysjobhistory h inner join msdb.dbo.sysjobs j on h.job_id = j.job_id where j.enabled = 1 and h.instance_id in (select max(h.instance_id) from msdb.dbo.sysjobhistory h where msdb.dbo.agent_datetime(h.run_date, h.run_time) > dateadd(minute, -5, getdate()) and h.step_id > 0 group by (h.job_id)) and h.run_status = 0 order by msdb.dbo.agent_datetime(h.run_date, h.run_time)desc for xml path(''))), '')

item.name: SQL: Memory\Pages Output/sec
item.description: Pages Output/sec is the rate at which pages are written to disk to free up space in physical memory. Pages are written back to disk only if they are changed in physical memory, so they are likely to hold data, not code. A high rate of pages output might indicate a memory shortage. Windows writes more pages back to disk to free up space when physical memory is in short supply. This counter shows the number of pages, and can be compared to other counts of pages, without conversion.

item.name: {$SQL2}: Buffer Manager\Buffer cache hit ratio(percentage)
item.description: Percentage of pages that were found in the buffer pool without having to incur a read from disk.

item.name: {$SQL2}: Checkpoint pages/sec
item.description: Low if under 300 for a some time

item.name: {$SQL2}: Page Life Expectancy
item.description: Low if under 300 for a some time

item.name: {$SQL2}: Data File Size
item.description: Total size (in kilobytes) of all the data files.

item.name: {$SQL2}: Log File Size
item.description: Total size (in kilobytes) of all the transaction log files.

item.name: {$SQL2}: Log File Used Size (Total)
item.description: The cumulative used size of all the log files in the database.

item.name: {$SQL2}: Transactions per second
item.description: Total number of transactions started for all databases per second.

item.name: {$SQL2}: Number Users Connected
item.description: Number of users connected to SQL Server.

item.name: {$SQL2}: Lock Waits per second
item.description: Number of lock requests that could not be satisfied immediately and required the caller to wait before being granted the lock.

item.name: {$SQL2}: Number of Deadlocks per second
item.description: Number of lock requests that resulted in a deadlock.

item.name: {$SQL2}: Memory Manager\Memory Grants Pending
item.description: Current number of processes waiting for a workspace memory grant

item.name: {$SQL2}: Total Server Memory
item.description: The committed memory from the buffer pool (in kilobytes). Note: this is not the total memory used by SQL Server.

item.name: {$SQL2}: Free space in tempdb
item.description: Total size (in kilobytes) of tempdb.

item.name: {$SQL2}: Longest Running Transaction
item.description: The running time of the longest running transaction, in seconds

item.name: SQL: % Processor Time
item.description: % Processor Time is the percentage of elapsed time that all of the threads of this process used the processor to execute instructions.

item.name: {$SQL2}: Number Failed Jobs
item.description: The number of jobs with a last run status of “Failed”.

item.name: Default Instance: Number Failed Jobs
item.description: The number of jobs with a last run status of “Failed”.

item.name: Default Instance: Buffer Manager\Buffer cache hit ratio(percentage)
item.description: Percentage of pages that were found in the buffer pool without having to incur a read from disk.

item.name: Default Instance: Checkpoint pages/sec
item.description: Low if under 300 for a some time

item.name: Default Instance: Page Life Expectancy
item.description: Low if under 300 for a some time

item.name: Default Instance: Data File Size
item.description: Total size (in kilobytes) of all the data files.

item.name: Default Instance: Log File Size
item.description: Total size (in kilobytes) of all the transaction log files.

item.name: Default Instance: Log File Used Size (Total)
item.description: The cumulative used size of all the log files in the database.

item.name: Default Instance: Transactions per second
item.description: Total number of transactions started for all databases per second.

item.name: Default Instance: Number Users Connected
item.description: Number of users connected to SQL Server.

item.name: Default Instance: Lock Waits per second
item.description: Number of lock requests that could not be satisfied immediately and required the caller to wait before being granted the lock.

item.name: Default Instance: Number of Deadlocks per second
item.description: Number of lock requests that resulted in a deadlock.

item.name: Default Instance: Memory Manager\Memory Grants Pending
item.description: Current number of processes waiting for a workspace memory grant

item.name: Default Instance: Total Server Memory
item.description: The committed memory from the buffer pool (in kilobytes). Note: this is not the total memory used by SQL Server.

item.name: Default Instance: Free space in tempdb
item.description: Total size (in kilobytes) of tempdb.

item.name: Default Instance: Longest Running Transaction
item.description: The running time of the longest running transaction, in seconds

discovery_rule.name: Database discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of Databases as defined in global regular expression "Databases for discovery".

item_prototype.name: SQL Server: Instance {#DBNAME}: State
item_prototype.params: select coalesce(max(state),7) from sys.databases where name = '{#DBNAME}'
item_prototype.description: State of a specific database. The values: 0 = ONLINE, 1 = RESTORING, 2 = RECOVERING, 3 = RECOVERY_PENDING, 4 = SUSPECT, 5 = EMERGENCY, 6 = OFFLINE, 7 = Database Does Not Exist on Server.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server: Instance {#DBNAME}: Data File Size
item_prototype.description: Cumulative size (in kilobytes) of all the data files in the database including any automatic growth.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server: Instance {#DBNAME}: Log cache reads/sec
item_prototype.description: Cumulative size (in kilobytes) of all the transaction log files in the database.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server: Instance {#DBNAME}: Log File Size
item_prototype.description: Cumulative size (in kilobytes) of all the transaction log files in the database.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server: Instance {#DBNAME}: Log Used File Size
item_prototype.description: Cumulative size (in kilobytes) of all the transaction log files in the database.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server: Instance {#DBNAME}: Percent Log Used
item_prototype.description: Cumulative size (in kilobytes) of all the transaction log files in the database.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server: Instance {#DBNAME}: Transactions per second
item_prototype.description: Number of transactions started for the database per second.

trigger_prototype.name: The database '{#DBNAME}' state is no longer online.

condition.value: @Microsoft SQL server service names for discovery

macro.value: One or more Attention LED indications.

item_prototype.name: Array {#NAME} Allocated Capacity
item_prototype.description: Allocated Capacity (TB).

item_prototype.name: Array {#NAME} BE Utilization
item_prototype.description: BE Utilization

item_prototype.name: Array {#NAME} Disk Utilization
item_prototype.description: Disk Utilization

item_prototype.name: Array {#NAME} FE Utilization
item_prototype.description: FE Utilization

item_prototype.name: Array {#NAME} Percent Subscribed Capacity
item_prototype.description: % Subscribed Capacity

item_prototype.name: Array {#NAME} RDF utilization
item_prototype.description: RDF Utilization.

item_prototype.name: Array {#NAME} Read Response Time
item_prototype.description: The calculated system read response time.

item_prototype.name: Array {#NAME} Subscribed Capacity
item_prototype.description: Subscribed Capacity (TB).

item_prototype.name: Array {#NAME} Usable Capacity
item_prototype.description: Usable Capacity (TB).

item_prototype.name: Array {#NAME} Write Response Time
item_prototype.description: The calculated system write response time.

item_prototype.name: FE Director {#NAME} Percent Busy LogicalCore 0
item_prototype.description: % Busy Logical Core 0

item_prototype.name: FE Director {#NAME} Percent Busy LogicalCore 1
item_prototype.description: % Busy Logical Core 1

item_prototype.name: FE Director {#NAME} Queue Depth Utilization
item_prototype.description: Front end director queue depth utilization, based on queue depth buckets

item_prototype.name: FE port {#NAME} The average IO size served by the port
item_prototype.description: The average IO size served by the port

item_prototype.name: FE port {#NAME} max number of gigabits moving through the port per second.
item_prototype.description: The max number of gigabits moving through the port per second.

item_prototype.name: FE port {#NAME} The total IO (reads and writes) per second in MBs.
item_prototype.description: The total IO (reads and writes) per second in MBs.

item_prototype.name: FE port {#NAME} The percent of time the port is busy.
item_prototype.description: The percent of time the port is busy.

item_prototype.name: FE port {#NAME} Response Time (ms)
item_prototype.description: Response Time (ms)

item_prototype.name: FE port {#NAME} number of gigabits moving through the port per second.
item_prototype.description: The number of gigabits moving through the port per second.

item_prototype.name: Storage Group {#NAME} BEPercentReads
item_prototype.description: BE % Reads

item_prototype.name: Storage Group {#NAME} BEPercentWrites
item_prototype.description: BE % writes

item_prototype.name: Storage Group {#NAME} CriticalAlertCount
item_prototype.description: Number of active performance alerts, critical severity

item_prototype.name: Storage Group {#NAME} HostIOs
item_prototype.description: The number of host operations performed each second by the group.

item_prototype.name: Storage Group {#NAME} HostMBs
item_prototype.description: Cumulative number of host MBs read/writes per second by the group

item_prototype.name: Storage Group {#NAME} PercentHit
item_prototype.description: The percent of IO operations that were immediately satisfied from cache.

item_prototype.name: Storage Group {#NAME} RDFS_WriteResponseTime
item_prototype.description: A summary of the read, write, and average response times for the selected SRDF/S group.

item_prototype.name: Storage Group {#NAME} Read Response Time
item_prototype.description: The average time that it took the Symmetrix to serve one read IO for this group.

item_prototype.name: Storage Group {#NAME} WarningAlertCount
item_prototype.description: Number of active performance alerts, warning severity

item_prototype.name: Storage Group {#NAME} Write Response Time
item_prototype.description: The average time that it took the Symmetrix to serve one write IO for this group.

trigger.expression: {Template DBMS Microsoft SQL Server_MultiInstance_WithDefaultInstance:perf_counter["\SQLServer:Buffer Manager\Buffer cache hit ratio",300].avg(10m)}<({$BUFFER_CACHE_HIT_RATIO})
trigger.name: SQL: Buffer Manager\Buffer cache hit ratio on the {HOST.NAME} < {$BUFFER_CACHE_HIT_RATIO}

trigger.expression: {Template DBMS Microsoft SQL Server_MultiInstance_WithDefaultInstance:perf_counter["\SQLServer:Memory Manager\Memory Grants Pending",60].avg(10m)}>0
trigger.name: SQL: Memory Manager\Memory Grants Pending on the {HOST.NAME} > 0

trigger.expression: {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "disk", "--item", "Data"].regexp(^OK$)}=0 or {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "enclosure", "--item", "Data"].regexp(^OK$)}=0 or {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "fcp", "--item", "Data"].regexp(^OK$)}=0 or {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "lun", "--item", "Data"].regexp(^OK$)}=0 or {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "pool", "--item", "Data"].regexp(^OK$)}=0
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} IBM DS data collector error
